info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mesa County through 630 PM MDT... At 548 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Grand Junction, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Mesa County, including the following locations... Clifton, Orchard Mesa, Fruitvale and Redlands. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 37. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 38. Colorado 141 between mile markers 160 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
